When people think of how much it will cost to buy a home, they tend to think of the purchase price. And no wonder: With median home prices in the U.S. at well over $200,000 (in 2015), the list price is a number that would grab anyone’s attention.

Deposit. This is the amount you put towards the cost of the property when you buy your home. On average, you need at least 5% to 20% of the purchase price (for example: £10,000 to £ 40,000 when buying a £200,000 home). Help to Buy and other housing schemes only require a 5% deposit.
